tweet: The President thinks he’s above the law. The American people deserve to hear the facts themselves. We must uphold the Constitution, and today’s impeachment resolution is a necessary next step towards knowing the truth.
pic.twitter.com/6dxA5oDC5J

Last call: join the #CongressionalAppChallenge by this Friday and you can see your app featured at the U.S. Capitol. Sign up at the link below and reach out to my office with questions. #Congress4cs https://www.congressionalappchallenge.us/

There are over 3.5 million breast cancer survivors in the United States - the earlier it's detected, the higher the survival rate. This #BreastCancerAwarenessMonth be sure to speak with your doctor about screenings and taking preventative measures.
Thank you to all first responders in #WA09 and across the country for dedicating your lives to keeping our communities safe. #FirstRespondersDay

The United States must remain vigilant in our fight against terrorism. While the death of al-Baghdadi is consequential, we must not mistake the demise of one ISIS leader for complete and finite victory. 

Read my full statement here: https://armedservices.house.gov/press-releases?ID=4D17E0DF-CB2A-435A-8624-2E0880E723B0 …
The success of the al-Baghdadi raid is a testament to the valor and skill of our military personnel and intelligence professionals, and we are grateful for their bravery and patriotism.
Happy #Diwali to all those celebrating the Festival of Lights in America and around the world! May we always bring light wherever we go.

It is also unacceptable that the President has been relentless in hurling a barrage of insults at the Kurds over the course of the last two weeks - literally adding insult to injury. The Kurds have fought alongside us, and if nothing else, they deserve our gratitude and respect.

The recent developments in Syria highlight the necessity for a new comprehensive strategy for containing Iran. I’m proud to work alongside our Kurdish constituents to discuss the critical work with partners and allies in our continued fight against terror. pic.twitter.com/Awu0cXJMPp

I joined @SenatorCantwell in stating our concern regarding the use of solitary confinement at the Northwest Detention Center. We urged the @DHSgov IG to take a close look at the policies and practices related to this and other reported abuses at the #NWDC. https://crosscut.com/2019/10/atmosphere-abuse-and-mistreatment-lawmakers-call-investigation-solitary-confinement-tacoma …

I personally thank the Kurdish people for all they have done and sacrificed for us in the fight against terrorism. I respect and honor our alliance with them and will do everything I can to try and help them rebuild.

What happened to the Kurds in Northeastern Syria is an abomination. The failure to do everything that we could to prevent the current fate of the Kurds is a betrayal of a key partner and a major foreign policy blunder. Read my full statement here:  https://adamsmith.house.gov/press-releases?ID=3AB8D541-C51A-4048-8317-6721725A91CE … pic.twitter.com/Zx8Ad3QKcb

No survivor of sexual violence should be denied swift access to justice. I joined my colleagues in passing the #DebbieSmithAct to #EndTheBacklog and ensure that justice is not delayed or denied because local police cannot afford to test a survivor’s rape kit.

The Trump admin continues its attempt to undermine scientists across federal agencies working on #ClimateChange. We need leaders who will listen to scientists and acknowledge the threat of climate change for what it is – an existential threat to the world. https://www.politico.com/news/2019/10/22/usda-inspector-general-launches-climate-change-investigation-054360 …

Like so many districts across the US, #WA09 is home to #DACA recipients. I hope all #DACA recipients know that #HomeIsHere and keep their status up to date. Renew yours today: https://www.uscis.gov/humanitarian/deferred-action-childhood-arrivals-response-january-2018-preliminary-injunction …

The passing of Rep. Cummings is a profound loss for the nation and those who, like me, were lucky enough to call him both a colleague and friend. 

A passionate advocate, he leaves the legacy of a generation who showed us that we can be better. For that, we are grateful.

The critical bills passed by the House today will hold leaders in Beijing accountable at a time when Hong Kong’s freedom is under threat. Leaders in Beijing and Hong Kong must address the legitimate concerns of these protestors - read more here:  https://adamsmith.house.gov/press-releases?ID=C1590EAA-1516-48A1-8050-221B34C6867D … pic.twitter.com/ESgdt8b3UH

On #IndigenousPeoplesDay, we honor the innumerable sacrifices of Native American communities. I am grateful to work with leaders in #WA09 and remain committed to promoting the well-being of local and regional Indigenous communities.

Applications for military academy nominations are due by Nov. 2.

It's an honor to nominate outstanding young men and women to the U.S. military academies each year - learn more here:  https://adamsmith.house.gov/military-academy-nominations …

Mental health is just as important as our physical health – we need to continue looking out for those that may be struggling, whether it’s apparent or not. Today and every day, check on your friends and seek help for yourself if you’re struggling. #WorldMentalHealthDay

Instead of pouring money into the wall, we should focus on ensuring the fair and humane treatment of children and families seeking asylum, something the president has failed to do. I thank @RepEscobar for her leadership on this issue. https://www.elpasotimes.com/story/news/immigration/2019/10/08/escobar-adam-smith-tour-new-border-wall-construction-new-mexico/3908906002/ …

This week I visited our southern border w/ @RepEscobar to see first-hand where Pentagon money has been diverted. It's obvious that the president is sacrificing national security to steal Pentagon funding for a border wall that is wasteful and counterproductive.
Wishing a peaceful and meaningful fast to all who are observing #YomKippur - may your time spent in reflection bring you peace this new year. G’mar Chatima Tovah.

President Trump wants to recalculate the poverty line so that fewer families are eligible for assistance as part of his #WarOnWorkingFamilies. This is unacceptable and we need to ensure working families have the opportunities they need to succeed. pic.twitter.com/viR3cbaoYr

The Trump Administration’s decision to withdraw U.S. military personnel from Northern Syria will harm American-backed Kurdish troops and is a catastrophic mistake. The Kurds have been our strongest ally in the fight against ISIS. Read more in my statement: https://adamsmith.house.gov/press-releases?ID=A736D98D-AC05-424B-B31B-3644690FA211 …

It's an honor to nominate outstanding young men and women each year to the U.S. military academies. The academies provide an excellent education and an exceptional opportunity to serve our country.

Submit your application by Nov. 2 - learn more here:  https://adamsmith.house.gov/military-academy-nominations …

I will continue working with @RepJayapal and my colleagues to stand up for immigrants and fight to bring humanity to the broken immigration detention system. I am hopeful that we can make progress towards a just immigration system that treats people with the dignity they deserve. https://twitter.com/RepJayapal/status/1180151572828999680 …

While the Trump Administration’s FCC continues to undermine strong net neutrality protections, I am encouraged that this court decision allows states to protect #NetNeutrality. Building on the House’s passage of the #SaveTheNet Act earlier this year, we must continue the fight. https://twitter.com/JRosenworcel/status/1179044724709167104 …
